data.title: Victor Emmanuel II of Italy (1820-1878)
data.meta_description:
Victor Emanuel II was king of Sardinia from 1849 until, on 17 March 1861.  He assumed the title King of Italy to become the first king of a united Italy since the 6th century, a title he held until his death in 1878. The Italians gave him the epithet Father of the Fatherland.
	
	Victor Emanuel was born the eldest son of Charles Albert, Prince of Carignano and Maria Theresa, Archduchess of Austria.  
	
	In 1842, he married his cousin Adelaide of Austria and they had eight children.
data.text:
Victor Emanuel II was king of Sardinia from 1849 until, on 17 March 1861. He assumed the title King of Italy to become the first king of a united Italy since the 6th century, a title he held until his death in 1878. The Italians gave him the epithet Father of the Fatherland.

Victor Emanuel was born the eldest son of Charles Albert, Prince of Carignano and Maria Theresa, Archduchess of Austria.

In 1842, he married his cousin Adelaide of Austria and they had eight children.
